task.title: Count Object Properties
task.problemStatement: Write a function that uses a for...in loop to iterate through an object and count all enumerable properties. Log the property names and their values.
task.expectedOutput: A list of all property names and their corresponding values from the object

challenges.title: Filter Own Properties Only
challenges.description: Create a function that iterates through an object using for...in and filters only own properties (not inherited) using hasOwnProperty(). Return the count and names.

challenges.title: Sum Numeric Values
challenges.description: Use for...in loop to iterate through an object and sum all numeric values. Return the total of all number properties.

challenges.title: Property Transformation
challenges.description: Iterate through an object using for...in, convert all property names to UPPERCASE, and create a new object with transformed keys while preserving values.

task.title: Iterate Array with For...Of
task.problemStatement: Write a function that uses a for...of loop to iterate through an array of numbers and calculate their sum. Stop iteration early if a negative number is encountered.
task.expectedOutput: The sum of numbers before encountering a negative value

challenges.title: Filter and Transform Array
challenges.description: Use for...of loop to iterate through an array, filter elements greater than 10, and transform them by multiplying by 2. Return the new array.

challenges.title: String Reversal from Array
challenges.description: Given an array of strings, use for...of to concatenate them in reverse order. Include proper spacing between words.

challenges.title: Nested Array Flattening
challenges.description: Use for...of loop to iterate through a nested array of arrays and flatten it into a single array while tracking the original depth of each element.

task.title: Extract and Modify Array Portions
task.problemStatement: Given an array [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7], use slice() to extract elements from index 2 to 5, and use splice() to remove 2 elements starting from index 3. Show the results of both operations.
task.expectedOutput: Original array modified by splice(), and a new array from slice() operation

challenges.title: Sandwich Array Slicing
challenges.description: Create a function that takes an array and extracts the middle 3 elements using slice() without modifying the original. Return the extracted elements.

challenges.title: Swap Array Sections
challenges.description: Use splice() to replace elements at index 2-4 with three new elements ['a', 'b', 'c']. Show both the modified array and removed elements.

challenges.title: Array Rotation with Slice and Splice
challenges.description: Create a function that rotates an array by n positions using slice(). For example, [1,2,3,4,5] rotated by 2 becomes [4,5,1,2,3].

task.title: Search Array Elements
task.problemStatement: Given an array of fruit names ['apple', 'banana', 'orange', 'banana', 'grape'], find the index of the first 'banana' using indexOf() and check if 'mango' exists using includes().
task.expectedOutput: Index of 'banana' and boolean result for 'mango' existence

challenges.title: Find All Occurrences
challenges.description: Create a function that finds all indices where a specific element appears in an array. Use indexOf() with a starting position to find multiple occurrences.

challenges.title: Validate User Input
challenges.description: Create a function that checks if a user's input matches any allowed values from a whitelist array using includes(). Return a validation message.

challenges.title: Duplicate Detector
challenges.description: Write a function that uses indexOf() to detect if an element appears more than once in an array, and return both the duplicate element and all its indices.

task.title: Extract String Portions
task.problemStatement: Given the string 'JavaScript', use slice() to extract 'Script' and extract the last 4 characters using negative indices. Show both results.
task.expectedOutput: Extracted substrings 'Script' and the last 4 characters

challenges.title: Extract Domain from Email
challenges.description: Create a function that takes an email address and extracts the domain name using slice(). For 'user@example.com', return 'example'.

challenges.title: Middle Character Extraction
challenges.description: Write a function that extracts the middle half of a string using slice(). For 'JavaScript', return 'aScr'.

challenges.title: Alternating Character Extraction
challenges.description: Create a function that uses slice() to extract every other character from a string, starting from position 1. For 'abcdefgh', return 'bdfh'.

task.title: Extract Substring Portion
task.problemStatement: Given the string 'Programming', use substring() to extract 'Progr' (positions 0-5) and extract from position 3 to the end. Compare with slice() behavior for negative indices.
task.expectedOutput: Extracted substrings using substring() method

challenges.title: Word Length Validator
challenges.description: Create a function that uses substring() to check if the first 3 characters of a string match a given prefix. Return true or false.

challenges.title: Substring Comparison
challenges.description: Write a function comparing slice() vs substring() behavior, especially with negative or reversed parameters. Document the differences.

challenges.title: Extract Between Delimiters
challenges.description: Create a function that extracts a substring between two specified positions using substring(). Handle edge cases where positions might be equal or reversed.

task.title: Convert String Cases
task.problemStatement: Given the string 'Hello World', convert it to uppercase using toUpperCase(), to lowercase using toLowerCase(), and create a camelCase version.
task.expectedOutput: String in uppercase, lowercase, and camelCase formats

challenges.title: Toggle Case
challenges.description: Create a function that toggles the case of each character in a string. 'HeLLo' becomes 'hEllO'. Use toUpperCase() and toLowerCase().

challenges.title: Case-Insensitive Comparison
challenges.description: Write a function that compares two strings ignoring case using toLowerCase(). Return true if they match, false otherwise.

challenges.title: Sentence Capitalization
challenges.description: Create a function that takes a sentence and capitalizes only the first letter of each sentence using case conversion methods.

task.title: Combine Multiple Strings
task.problemStatement: Given three strings 'Hello', 'Beautiful', 'World', concatenate them with spaces using concat() method. Also demonstrate using the + operator and template literals.
task.expectedOutput: The concatenated string 'Hello Beautiful World' using different methods

challenges.title: Build URL Path
challenges.description: Create a function that concatenates URL segments: domain, path, and query parameters. Use concat() to combine them into a complete URL.

challenges.title: CSV Line Builder
challenges.description: Write a function that takes an array of values and concatenates them with commas to create a CSV line. Handle proper formatting.

challenges.title: Multi-method String Building
challenges.description: Create a function that builds a complex string using concat(), + operator, and template literals, and compare performance with different approaches.

task.title: Remove Whitespace
task.problemStatement: Given the string '  JavaScript  ', use trim() to remove leading and trailing spaces. Also use trimStart() and trimEnd() to demonstrate their individual effects.
task.expectedOutput: Strings with whitespace removed using different trim methods

challenges.title: Form Input Sanitizer
challenges.description: Create a function that sanitizes user form input by trimming whitespace and converting to lowercase. Handle multiple inputs.

challenges.title: Selective Trim
challenges.description: Write a function that removes only leading or only trailing whitespace based on a parameter. Show all three trim variants.

challenges.title: Multi-line String Processor
challenges.description: Create a function that trims whitespace from each line of a multi-line string while preserving line breaks and internal spacing.

task.title: Replace String Content
task.problemStatement: Given the string 'I love cats. Cats are cute.', use replace() to replace the first 'cats' with 'dogs', and use replaceAll() to replace all 'Cats' with 'Dogs'. Show case sensitivity.
task.expectedOutput: Strings with replaced content showing difference between replace() and replaceAll()

challenges.title: Text Template Engine
challenges.description: Create a function that replaces template variables like {{name}} and {{age}} with actual values. Use replace() or replaceAll() with proper handling.

challenges.title: URL Query Parameter Replacer
challenges.description: Write a function that replaces URL query parameters. Replace ?old=value with ?new=value using string methods.

challenges.title: Regex-based Replace
challenges.description: Create a function that uses replace() with regex patterns to replace all vowels with asterisks (*) or remove all numbers from a string.

task.title: Split String into Array
task.problemStatement: Given the string 'apple,banana,orange,grape', use split() to create an array with each fruit as an element. Also split by different delimiters.
task.expectedOutput: An array of individual fruit names separated by commas

challenges.title: CSV Parser
challenges.description: Create a function that parses a CSV string into an array of records. Handle proper splitting by commas and ignore commas inside quoted fields.

challenges.title: Word Frequency Counter
challenges.description: Write a function that splits a sentence into words, counts each word's frequency, and returns the most common word. Use split(' ').

challenges.title: Path Parser
challenges.description: Create a function that splits file paths (like 'C:\Users\Documents\file.txt') and extracts directory components and filename.

task.title: Create and Explore Objects
task.problemStatement: Create an object representing a student with properties: name, age, gpa, courses (array). Explain the structure and how to access properties using dot notation.
task.expectedOutput: A well-structured student object with all properties accessible

challenges.title: Object Property Checker
challenges.description: Create a function that checks if specific properties exist in an object using hasOwnProperty() and the 'in' operator. Explain the difference.

challenges.title: Object Cloning
challenges.description: Write a function that creates a shallow copy of an object and a deep copy. Demonstrate the difference when nested objects are modified.

challenges.title: Object Freezing
challenges.description: Create functions that freeze an object using Object.freeze(), seal it, and prevent extensions. Demonstrate what operations are allowed/blocked.

task.title: Object Creation Methods
task.problemStatement: Create a book object using object literal syntax with properties: title, author, year, pages. Access properties using both dot notation and bracket notation.
task.expectedOutput: A book object with properties accessible via dot and bracket notation

challenges.title: Dynamic Property Access
challenges.description: Create a function that dynamically accesses object properties based on a variable property name using bracket notation. Handle missing properties gracefully.

challenges.title: Object Constructor Function
challenges.description: Write a constructor function 'Car' that creates car objects with properties (make, model, year). Create instances using the 'new' keyword.

challenges.title: Property Descriptor Control
challenges.description: Use Object.defineProperty() to create object properties with specific descriptors (writable, enumerable, configurable). Demonstrate the effects.

task.title: Add Methods to Objects
task.problemStatement: Create a calculator object with properties (x, y) and methods add(), subtract(), multiply(). Call each method and display results.
task.expectedOutput: Calculator object performing arithmetic operations through its methods

challenges.title: String Manipulation Object
challenges.description: Create an object with methods: reverse(), capitalize(), countVowels() that operate on a stored string property. Chain methods if possible.

challenges.title: Counter Object
challenges.description: Create a counter object with methods: increment(), decrement(), reset(), getValue(). Maintain internal state and prevent direct property access.

challenges.title: Object with Getters and Setters
challenges.description: Create an object using getter and setter properties to manage a private temperature value. Validate temperature range on set.

task.title: Understanding This Context
task.problemStatement: Create a person object with name, age, introduce() method. Inside introduce(), use 'this' to access the object's properties and create a greeting message.
task.expectedOutput: A greeting message using 'this' keyword to reference object properties

challenges.title: This Context Binding
challenges.description: Create a function that's assigned to different objects as a method. Show how 'this' changes depending on context. Demonstrate bind(), call(), and apply().

challenges.title: Arrow Function Context
challenges.description: Compare 'this' behavior in regular methods vs arrow functions. Show that arrow functions inherit 'this' from their enclosing scope.

challenges.title: Banking Account System
challenges.description: Create account objects with balance property and methods like deposit(), withdraw(). Use 'this' properly to modify and access the balance.

task.title: Use Math Methods
task.problemStatement: Use Math methods to: find the largest of [15, 23, 8, 42], round 4.7 to nearest integer, find square root of 25, and generate a random number between 1-10.
task.expectedOutput: Results from Math.max(), Math.round(), Math.sqrt(), and Math.random()

challenges.title: Random Number Generator
challenges.description: Create a function that generates a random integer within a specified range [min, max] using Math.random(). Use Math.floor() appropriately.

challenges.title: Distance Calculator
challenges.description: Write a function that calculates the distance between two points using the Pythagorean theorem with Math.sqrt() and Math.pow().

challenges.title: Trigonometry Functions
challenges.description: Create a calculator that uses Math.sin(), Math.cos(), Math.tan() to solve trigonometric problems. Include angle conversion between degrees and radians.

task.title: Use Number Methods
task.problemStatement: Use Number methods to: check if 42 is an integer using isInteger(), convert '123abc' to number using parseInt(), convert '3.14' to float using parseFloat().
task.expectedOutput: Results from Number.isInteger(), parseInt(), and parseFloat() methods

challenges.title: Number Validation
challenges.description: Create a function that validates if a value is a valid finite number using Number.isFinite(), isNaN(), and isInteger(). Handle edge cases.

challenges.title: Number Formatting
challenges.description: Use toFixed(), toPrecision(), and toExponential() methods to format numbers in different ways. Create a display function for currency values.

challenges.title: Number Range Checker
challenges.description: Write a function using Number.MAX_VALUE, Number.MIN_VALUE, Number.MAX_SAFE_INTEGER to check if numbers fall within safe computing ranges.

task.title: String Object Methods
task.problemStatement: Use String methods: charAt(2) to get character at index 2, charCodeAt() to get character code, fromCharCode() to create strings from character codes.
task.expectedOutput: Results from charAt(), charCodeAt(), and String.fromCharCode() operations

challenges.title: String Padding
challenges.description: Create a function that uses padStart() and padEnd() to format strings with fixed width. Useful for creating columns in text displays.

challenges.title: String Searching
challenges.description: Use indexOf(), lastIndexOf(), includes(), startsWith(), endsWith() to search strings comprehensively. Create a search function.

challenges.title: Character Code Encryption
challenges.description: Create an encryption function that converts each character to its character code, manipulates it, then converts back. Implement decryption too.

task.title: Create and Display Dates
task.problemStatement: Create a Date object for today, create one for December 25, 2024, and create one from milliseconds (1000000000000). Display all three dates.
task.expectedOutput: Three different Date objects displayed in various formats

challenges.title: Age Calculator
challenges.description: Create a function that calculates a person's age in years given their birth date. Use Date objects and handle leap years.

challenges.title: Days Between Dates
challenges.description: Write a function that calculates the number of days between two dates using Date objects and timestamp differences.

challenges.title: Timezone Aware Dates
challenges.description: Create a function that handles dates across different timezones using UTC methods. Convert between local and UTC time.

task.title: Extract Date Components
task.problemStatement: Create a Date object for today and use getFullYear(), getMonth(), getDate(), getDay() to extract year, month, date, and day of week.
task.expectedOutput: Date components: year, month number, date, and day of week as separate values

challenges.title: Date Formatter
challenges.description: Create a function that formats a date object into readable string like 'Monday, January 19, 2026' using Date methods.

challenges.title: Time Component Extractor
challenges.description: Use getHours(), getMinutes(), getSeconds() to extract time components and create a formatted time display (HH:MM:SS).

challenges.title: Date Setter Operations
challenges.description: Create functions that use setFullYear(), setMonth(), setDate() to manipulate dates. Add days, months, and years to a given date.

task.title: Work with Sets
task.problemStatement: Create a Set with values [1, 2, 3, 2, 1]. Add a new value 4, check if 2 exists using has(), and convert back to array to see unique values only.
task.expectedOutput: Set containing unique values, demonstrating uniqueness property

challenges.title: Array Duplicate Remover
challenges.description: Create a function that removes duplicates from an array by converting to Set and back. Compare with other deduplication methods.

challenges.title: Set Operations
challenges.description: Create functions to perform Set operations: union (combine two sets), intersection (common elements), difference (elements in one but not other).

challenges.title: Set Performance Comparison
challenges.description: Create a performance test comparing Set.has() vs Array.includes() for finding elements in large collections. Document findings.

task.title: Work with Maps
task.problemStatement: Create a Map with key-value pairs: ('apple', 5), ('banana', 3), ('orange', 7). Use get() to retrieve values, set() to add new items, and check size property.
task.expectedOutput: Map with proper key-value pairs, retrievable values, and size

challenges.title: Frequency Counter with Map
challenges.description: Create a function that counts word frequency in a sentence using a Map. Use get() and set() to update counts.

challenges.title: Map vs Object
challenges.description: Compare Map and Object as data structures. Show advantages of Map (any key type, size property, iteration) vs Objects.

challenges.title: LRU Cache Implementation
challenges.description: Create a Least Recently Used (LRU) cache using Map. Implement get(), set() with size limits and automatic removal of least recently used items.

task.title: Convert Between JSON and Objects
task.problemStatement: Create a JavaScript object for a book, convert it to JSON using JSON.stringify(), then parse it back using JSON.parse(). Verify the result matches original.
task.expectedOutput: JSON string representation and parsed object that matches the original

challenges.title: Pretty JSON Formatter
challenges.description: Create a function that formats JSON with proper indentation for display. Use JSON.stringify() with formatting parameters.

challenges.title: JSON Validation
challenges.description: Write a function that validates if a string is valid JSON without throwing errors. Try/catch parse attempts or validate structure.

challenges.title: Custom Serialization
challenges.description: Create custom replacer and reviver functions for JSON.stringify() and JSON.parse(). Handle Date objects and special types.

task.title: Use Template Literals
task.problemStatement: Create variables name='John', age=25. Use template literals to create a message: 'My name is John and I am 25 years old'. Include expression evaluation.
task.expectedOutput: A formatted string created with template literals and embedded expressions

challenges.title: Multi-line Strings
challenges.description: Create multi-line strings using template literals, including HTML/SQL. Show how template literals preserve whitespace and formatting.

challenges.title: Dynamic Content Insertion
challenges.description: Create a function using template literals to generate HTML elements dynamically. Include loop-based content and conditional expressions.

challenges.title: Tagged Template Literals
challenges.description: Create a custom tag function that processes template literal values. Implement formatting or translation logic in the tag function.

task.title: Destructure Arrays
task.problemStatement: Given array [10, 20, 30, 40, 50], destructure to get first two values into variables a, b, and remaining into rest array using the rest operator.
task.expectedOutput: Variables a=10, b=20, rest=[30, 40, 50]

challenges.title: Swap Variables with Destructuring
challenges.description: Use array destructuring to swap values of two variables without using a temporary variable. Show the elegant solution.

challenges.title: Nested Array Destructuring
challenges.description: Destructure a nested array like [[1, 2], [3, 4]] to extract individual values. Use nested destructuring syntax.

challenges.title: Function Parameter Destructuring
challenges.description: Create a function that receives an array as parameter and uses destructuring in the parameter list to extract values.

task.title: Destructure Objects
task.problemStatement: Given object {name: 'Alice', age: 28, city: 'New York'}, destructure to extract name and age variables. Show how to use different variable names with colon syntax.
task.expectedOutput: Extracted variables: name and age from the object

challenges.title: Nested Object Destructuring
challenges.description: Destructure a nested object like {user: {name: 'Bob', email: 'bob@example.com'}} to extract nested values.

challenges.title: Default Values
challenges.description: Use object destructuring with default values. Extract properties that may not exist in the object.

challenges.title: Function Parameter Destructuring
challenges.description: Create a function that destructures object parameters. Build a user profile function that receives {name, email, phone} as destructured parameter.

task.title: Use Spread Operator
task.problemStatement: Use spread operator to: merge arrays [1,2] and [3,4] into [1,2,3,4], copy an array, and expand array elements as function arguments.
task.expectedOutput: Merged array, copied array, and results of function called with spread array

challenges.title: Object Spreading
challenges.description: Use spread operator to merge two objects {a: 1} and {b: 2} into {a: 1, b: 2}. Show how later properties override earlier ones.

challenges.title: Shallow Copy vs Deep Copy
challenges.description: Demonstrate spread operator for shallow copying arrays and objects. Show limitations with nested structures and when deep copy is needed.

challenges.title: String to Array Conversion
challenges.description: Use spread operator to convert strings into character arrays. Compare with split() method.

task.title: Use Rest Parameters
task.problemStatement: Create a function that accepts multiple numbers as arguments using rest parameters (...numbers) and returns their sum. Show how rest parameters collect remaining arguments.
task.expectedOutput: Function that sums any number of arguments passed to it

challenges.title: Rest Parameters with Regular Parameters
challenges.description: Create a function with regular parameters followed by rest parameters. Combine required parameters with variable arguments.

challenges.title: Rest vs Arguments
challenges.description: Compare rest parameters with the arguments object. Show advantages of rest parameters (array methods, more readable code).

challenges.title: Function Composition with Rest
challenges.description: Create higher-order functions that use rest parameters to accept and apply multiple functions in sequence.
